thread.title: CNN’s Cuomo Forced To Apologize After Saying ‘Fake News’ Is ‘The N-Word For Journalists’
thread.title_full: CNN’s Cuomo Forced To Apologize After Saying ‘Fake News’ Is ‘The N-Word For Journalists’

author: Alicia Powe
title: CNN’s Cuomo Forced To Apologize After Saying ‘Fake News’ Is ‘The N-Word For Journalists’
text:
Sanders Shrugs Off Business Owner’s Concern About Obamacare 
Cuomo’s remarks about fake news were in response to a tweet from Trump that accused Cuomo of conducting a poor interview with Democratic Sen. Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut. Chris Cuomo, in his interview with Sen. Blumenthal, never asked him about his long-term lie about his brave "service" in Vietnam. FAKE NEWS! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 9, 2017 
The CNN host’s comments echoed his remarks earlier in the day on-air on CNN, when he said being called “fake news” is “like an ethnic disparagement.” Advertisement - story continues below 
“‘Fake news’ is the worst thing that you could call a journalist. It’s like an ethnic disparagement,” he said, prompting laughter from co-host Alisyn Camerota. “We all have these ugly words for people, and that’s the one for journalists.” 
Many on social media slammed Cuomo for making the comparison of “fake news” and the N-word. Chris Cuomo says the N word and fake lews label are the same thing. This is insanity. CNN is becoming a joke. https://t.co/GmRcCUlu93 
— David Bellavia (@DavidBellavia) February 9, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
